prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of O. Henry from the Doubleday and Company Archive, Accession #7457 , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the Library by Doubleday and Company through Raymond R. Ammarelle, Charlottesville, Virginia, on March 21, 1964.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts and typescripts of several short stories by O. Henry; radio adaptations of O. Henry stories by Henry Fisk Carlton, one in collaboration with Robert Winternitz; material regarding a film adaptation of "Best Seller" by Roy Mason; and an unpublished biographical account of Henry's Texas days by Paul Adams.

With these are a letter, 1908? July 16, Henry to Stephen Fiske thanking him for favorable reviews; correspondence, 1910, 1925, of Fiske and Mason with Doubleday and Co.; and a letter, 1958 June 20, of Kate Steichen regarding Doubleday's Henry collection with a bibliography of his work.
There are also three printed articles by Henry, and a published letter and pen-and-ink drawing by him.
